Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let me list out the events with their details to see if I can find links. Maybe start by looking for patients that have the same attributes that might indicate theyre the same person. Like, same patient age, gender, or maybe even some unique identifiers in the additional info?

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at patient age and gender, maybe some patients have the same combination. For instance, patient age 45 male appears in events 1,4,12,15. Similarly, age 62 female is in 2,5,8,11,14,17. Age 28 male in 3,6,9,13,16.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: each register is a new patient. So each time someone is registered, thats a new case unless they come back. But given that the timeline is short, maybe each register is a new case.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Patient1s path so far: register -> triage (Event4). After triage, what next? ... Patient1s events would be: 1 (register ER), 4 (triage ER), 7 (X-ray Radiology?), ... Register (1) Triage (4) Doctor consultation (12) Discharge (15).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Patient2 (62F): Register (Event2) Triage (Event5) Lab test (Event8) Lab completed (Event10) Consultation (Event11) Prescription (Event14) Discharge (Event17).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: the 28M patients case includes Events3,6,9,13,16. ... Register (Event3) Consult (Event6) Prep (Event9) Surgery (Event13) Recovery (Event16).

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Hmm, thats a problem. Wait, the patients case ends at Event16 (recovery room) but without a discharge event? ... Or perhaps the case ends at the recovery room?

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case1: 5 events covers Events 1,4,7,12,15 Case2: 7 Events 2,5,8,10,11,14,17 Case3:5 Events3,6,9,13,16 Thats 5+7+5=17 events. Perfect, all events are accounted for.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: All the time differences seem reasonable for hospital processes. Therefore, the three cases are correctly identified
